column4: How do I start up a graphical program over ssh so that it starts on the remote co
How do you mean? Do you want to see the program on your screen or the remote screen?
You need to know the DISPLAY variable of the remote screen
From SSH, type "w" and look in the FROM column
You should notice something like ":0" or ":1" on one of the lines
Then you can type "export DISPLAY=':0'" or "export DISPLAY=':1'"
and then any graphical programs you run will show up on the remote screen
Okay, I type that after the command to run the application?
No, type the export command first
And if you want to close SSH without closing the program, you can add " & disown" to the end of it
If all you're using this SSH connection for is starting the program, you could even include all this on the SSH command
For example: ssh user@remotehost "DISPLAY=:0 gedit & disown"
That will run gedit on display :0 and then disconnect
If you setup private key authentication, you wont even have to type your password
